com.jpaulmorrison.fbp.core.engine

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.jpaulmorrison.fbp.core.engine.Component
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Affix, Balloon, BuildBlob, ChainOps, CheckBallooning, CheckForDupNames, CheckSequenceWithinSubstreams, Collate, ConcatStreams, ConcatString, Copy, Counter, Crash, DeCompose, DedupeSuccessive, Discard, DispIPCounts, DuplicateString, EnhancedWriteFile, FBPComponentTemplate, FieldLimits, FileReadLines, FixDEATsInGEDCOMFile, Gate, GenerateFixedSizeArray, GenerateOptionalArray, GenerateSlowly, GenerateTestData, GenerateWordCounts, GenSamples, GenSS, GenSubStreams, Heartbeat, Inject, Interpret, JFilter, JingleBells, JingleBells2, Kick, KickWD, LDIFScan, LineToWords, ListFiles, LoadBalance, LowerCase, MixerInput, Network, Obscure, Output, PadFields, Passthru, Prefix, RandomDelay, ReadEmails, ReadFile, ReadFromSocket, ReCompose, RegExReplace, ReplaceRegExp, ReplaceString, ReplString, RRMerge, SelNthItem, ShowText, ShowURL, SlowPass, Sort, SoundMixer, Splitter1, StartsWith, StripPunct, SubIn, SubInSS, SubOI, SubOut, SubOutSS, SubstreamSensitiveMerge, TabulaRasa, TestStack, Text2IntArray, WordsToLine, WriteFile, WriteReadConsole, WriteToConsole, WriteToSocket

    public abstract class Component
extends java.lang.Thread
    All components must extend this class, defining its two abstract methods openPorts and execute. There will be an instance of this class for every node in the network. It is also returned by the 'component' method in network definitions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

      • drop

        protected void drop(Packet p)
        Drop Packet and clear owner reference. Note: Java will not reclaim the space until after all references to this packet have been cleared - ideally, one should not use this knowledge, but bright people probably will!

      • push

        public void push(Packet p)
        Push Packet onto stack and clear owner reference.

      • pop

        public Packet pop()
        Pop Packet off stack or return null if empty.

      • attach

        public void attach(Packet pkt,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   Packet subordinate)
        Maintains a Chain of Packets attached to this Packet. A Packet may have multiple named Chains attached to it, accessed via a HashMap. Since Packets are attached to Chains, as well as Chains to Packets, this results in an alternation of Packets and Chains, creating a tree structure.

      • detach

        public void detach(Packet pkt,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   Packet subordinate)
        Detach Packet from named chain

      • putGlobal

        protected java.lang.Object putGlobal(java.lang.String s,
                                     java.lang.Object o)
        putGlobal provides access to the private final field globals, a synchronizedMap. Use this carefully as global data creates a fat coupling.
        Parameters:
        s - The String key to the global field
        o - The Object value to be stored at the String key.
        Returns:
        Object containing the old entry if one is replaced, or null, if none is replaced.

      • getGlobal

        protected java.lang.Object getGlobal(java.lang.String s)
        getGlobal provides access to the private final field globals, a synchronizedMap. The specific global data required is accessed by means of a String key. Use putGlobal to update.
        Parameters:
        s - The String key to the global field
        Returns:
        Object containing the entry if one is found, or null, if none is found.

      • stackSize

        protected int stackSize()
        Return current size of stack.

      • execute

        protected abstract void execute()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Components override this method with their program. This method is called from a private thread.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if there is any error or exception in the program; this is a kludge until we work out how to integrate exceptions properly.
        java.lang.Exception

      • openInput

        protected final InputPort openInput(java.lang.String name)
        Components call this method from their openPorts method to open an InputPort, either a regular port or a parameter port.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the InputPort
        Returns:
        the InputPort, which should be assigned to an instance variable of the component

      • openInputArray

        protected final InputPort[] openInputArray(java.lang.String name,
                                           int arraySize)
        Components call this method from their openPorts method to open an array of InputPorts. If arraySize is not specified, the size of the Array is determined by the network to which this component belongs.
        Parameters:
        name - of the InputPort array, and optional arraySize
        Returns:
        the InputPort[] object, which should be assigned to an instance variable.

      • openInputArray

        protected final InputPort[] openInputArray(java.lang.String name)

      • openOutput

        protected final OutputPort openOutput(java.lang.String name)
        Components call this method from their openPorts method to open an output port.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the OutputPort
        Returns:
        the OutputPort, which should be assigned to an instance variable

      • openOutputArray

        protected final OutputPort[] openOutputArray(java.lang.String name,
                                             int arraySize)
        Components call this method from their openPorts method to open an array of OutputPorts. If arraySize is not specified, the size of the Array is determined by the network to which this component belongs.
        Parameters:
        name - of the OutputPort array, and optional arraySize
        Returns:
        the OutputPort[] object, which should be assigned to an instance variable.

      • longWaitEnd

        protected void longWaitEnd()

      • findInputPortElementWithData

        protected int findInputPortElementWithData(InputPort[] ports)
                                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This function finds the array element of an input array port which has data, and returns the element number; if all elements are drained, it returns a value of -1; for other cases this functions suspends until data arrives at a port array element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • openPorts

        protected abstract void openPorts()
        Components override this method to open their ports. This method is called from the network's main thread, and should only call openInput, openInputArray, openOutput, openOutputArray, InputPort.setType, and OutputPort.setType.

      • checkPorts

        protected boolean checkPorts()

      • getTracing

        public boolean getTracing()

        Terminates the component.
        Parameters:
        newStatus - the new status of the component (mostly TERMINATED or ERROR)
